image.altText: An image composite showing Donald Trump speaking and Joe Biden responding.

props.synopsis: US President Joe Biden and former president Donald Trump are done debating in Atlanta, Georgia for the first debate ahead of this year's presidential election. Follow live.

title.children: Trump and Biden trade personal jabs about age and who is the 'worst president in history' as debate ends

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: A disastrous night for President Biden
Democrats are talking about replacing Biden, says CNN correspondent
Biden and Trump argue about their golf handicaps

image.altText: A close up image of a baby sleeping, his eyes are closed and he is lying on one arm.

props.synopsis: Maria thought she was doing the right thing by connecting with the sperm donor she used to conceive her baby. She now wants the clinic to warn other families.

title.children: Maria used a sperm donor to have her son. Then the man tracked her down

image.altText: PROXY - Polly and the Queen

props.synopsis: She's renowned for her photography, but Australian-born, LA-based artist Polly Borland has used inspiration from the pandemic and her famous architect father to create a stunning sculptural exhibition.

title.children: She lists David Walsh as an early fan, now Polly Borland's photograph of The Queen is on loan to Mona

image.altText: Two women look at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: Nine Entertainment has announced it'll cut up to 200 jobs, ASX trading higher in midday trade. Follow the day's events and insights as they happen with our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Live updates: Nine to axe 200 jobs, ASX trades higher

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Treasurer says Suncorp takeover subject to 'strict conditions'
ANZ says its takeover of Suncorp is approved

image.altText: A close up of Jarryd Hayne with his hand on his chin

props.synopsis: The Crown said in court that it would take no further proceedings against Jarryd Hayne and his bail conditions were discontinued.

title.children: Former NRL star Hayne speaks publicly for first time since successful sexual assault appeal

image.altText: bullock chalmers

props.synopsis: A rate rise as soon as August is now a distinct possibility, and will make the government's cost-of-living pitch more complicated.

title.children: Is one more rate rise now on the horizon, and could it sink the government?

image.altText: An illustration of a woman swimming in a pool in the Australian bush

props.synopsis: House-sitting platforms are connecting sitters and home owners for a fee. But who's responsible when things go wrong?

title.children: 'We keep finding things that are not right': Should you trust a house-sitter from the internet?

image.altText: Autism Tasmania logo

props.synopsis: After 30 years of providing help for people with autism Tasmania's peak body, Autism Tasmania, will close due to funding being discontinued, with many of those affected reeling over the news, advocates say.

title.children: Autism Tasmania staff 'devastated' after being told peak body is shutting down due to lack of funding

image.altText: Sepia image of woman holding bald-headed baby

props.synopsis: For families in Darwin, the chance of sleep on Christmas Eve in 1974 vanished as they endured one of the worst natural disasters in the country. Fifty years on, one couple shares the "miracle" that kept their infant son alive as the cyclone raged around them.

title.children: Cyclone Tracy blew Pam and her baby out of their home. An ordinary object helped keep him alive

image.altText: an aerial shot of a housing estate

props.synopsis: ABS data reveals a big lift in household wealth driven by Australia's white-hot property market.

title.children: Millions of Australian households just made $25,000 without lifting a finger

image.altText: A man in suit gets out of a ca r

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese needs to take the win and move on from the successful negotiation of Julian Assange's freedom. The issue could become sticky fly paper and with troubling inflation and senator Fatima Payman voting across party lines, he now has other problems to tackle.

title.children: The Assange light and sound show overshadows government problems but it can't last

image.altText: Corbin family and deceased pilot

props.synopsis: A long-awaited coroner's report into a veteran pilot's death is handed down, deeming it a "tragic" accident — with one of his daughters just "weeks away" from "following in her dad's footsteps" by getting her own commercial helicopter licence.

title.children: Family says pilot's legacy will 'live on' as coroner releases findings into fatal helicopter crash

image.altText: Molly Roden Winter and her husband stand close together smiling for a selfie with mountains and blue sky behind them.

props.synopsis: When Molly Roden Winter and her husband first dabbled in non-monogamy, it felt dangerous and exciting. They've now had an open marriage for over a decade, and it hasn't been without challenges. Telling the kids was one of them.

title.children: This couple rewrote their marriage rules so they could see other people. Then they had to tell the kids

image.altText: a male customer stands waiting at a pharmacy counter

props.synopsis: Priceline, TerryWhite Chemmart and other major pharmacy chains reject new vaping laws making them the only legal sellers of vapes, signalling to franchisees they should not sell the products without a prescription.

title.children: Priceline, TerryWhite Chemmart and other major brands reject vape laws, despite becoming exclusive retailers

image.altText: A Palestinian man reacts as he says goodbye to his sick daughter

props.synopsis: Tears and relief as sick and wounded children are among 68 people who have been medically evacuated from the Gaza Strip so they can have treatment abroad, marking the first medical evacuation in nearly two months.

title.children: Sick and injured children medically evacuated from Gaza for first time in months

image.altText: Joshua Patrick and his Mum

props.synopsis: It's estimated about one in six Australian children grow up in poverty but, without an official poverty line, advocates say the government is flying blind on a crucial issue.

title.children: This family is struggling to get by. Why don't we know how many are like them?

image.altText: Four nuclear power station chimneys emit steam

props.synopsis: Nuclear power is in the headlines a lot right now. So we ask energy experts to break down exactly what it is.

title.children: What is nuclear energy and how does it work?

image.altText: Expired rapid antigen tests (RATs) fill a red office bin marked landfill

props.synopsis: After ordering more COVID-19 rapid antigen tests per capita than any other state in the country, WA is now set to fork out almost $4 million to destroy the excess and now unusable tests sitting in a warehouse.

title.children: Getting rid of WA's 19 million unusable COVID tests set to cost taxpayers millions

image.altText: Luna is leaning over and smiling at the camera. She has a nose tube.

props.synopsis: Parents are hoping the government could help with millions of dollars so they can travel to access the drug while Australia's regulators consider its use at home.

title.children: Luna's parents are pleading with the federal government to help access a rare cancer treatment

image.altText: Old man looking at camera, holding up photograph of cream Mercedes Benz car.

props.synopsis: Retired farmer and mechanic Doug Marchant has had a rough run this month with his beloved vintage car stolen from outside his home, and then its replacement broke down more than 1,300km from home.

title.children: When thieves took 94yo Doug's vintage Merc they stole his independence too

image.altText: Daniel Victor Gandini, wearing a three piece suit and peak cap, standing in the sunshine on the street in Burnie.

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian man found guilty of two counts of assault and of splashing a corrosive acid on arresting police officers in 2021 has been sentenced to jail.

title.children: 'Diplomat Dan' sentenced to more than three years' jail over assault of wife, splashing acid on police

image.altText: Two men chatting and holding beers while sitting on deck chairs in the grass in front of a field.

props.synopsis: It's "critically important" men look out for their friends and their friends' partners when it comes to domestic and family violence, experts say.

title.children: Concerned about a mate's behaviour towards their partner? Here's how to handle it

image.altText: People climbing on top and standing on blue barrels and a truck with hoses down the side

props.synopsis: India's government deploys water tankers to the capital's poorest areas, but it's not enough. The desperate situation sees private suppliers selling water at exorbitant prices.

title.children: As India swelters in record heat, the New Delhi 'water tanker mafia' is back up and running

image.altText: A mugshot of a man in a composite image with a court house.

props.synopsis: A teenage boy who performed first aid on his mum and CPR on her new boyfriend, who had both been stabbed by the boy's father, has been praised by a judge for "undoubtedly" saving his mother's life.

title.children: 'Family violence of the most extreme kind': Man sentenced for stabbing ex-partner, new boyfriend in front of children

image.altText: The watercolour painting featuring Harry Potter in front of the Hogwarts Express at Kings Cross Station

props.synopsis: Thomas Taylor was just 23 years old when he landed his first professional commission to illustrate the first Harry Potter book cover. It's now sold at auction for $2.8 million.

title.children: One of the most famous book covers in history just sold for nearly $3 million

image.altText: A man with a beard and glasses stands at a podium in front of a banner with the image of late Iranian president Ebrahim Raisi.

props.synopsis: Voters are heading to the polls a year early to usher in new leadership at a time when the Iranian regime faces deteriorating domestic support and rising regional turmoil.

title.children: 'Unprecedented in Iran's recent history': President's death triggers a snap election as voters hit the polls

image.altText: A flag raising team from a primary school.

props.synopsis: Hong Kong's Education Department singles out two schools after an inspection finds their students are not putting enough effort into singing the anthem amid an increasing push for patriotism in the city's schools.

title.children: Hong Kong inspectors find some students are singing the national anthem 'too softly'

image.altText: A man looks to his left as he buttons his suit jacket.

props.synopsis: It is the latest development in the lawsuit in which Prince Harry has claimed the newspaper violated his privacy by unlawfully snooping on him.

title.children: Lawyer for UK's The Sun accuses Prince Harry of destroying communication with Spare ghostwriter

image.altText: Ryan Moloney in a white shirt, brown hair with greying beard, smiling warmly

props.synopsis: Actor Ryan Moloney plans to move behind the scenes as a director on Neighbours, with his beloved character Jarrod "Toadie" Rebecchi leaving the show after 30 years.

title.children: Toadie to leave Neighbours after 30 years as actor Ryan Moloney heads behind the scenes

image.altText: a sign reading "FIGHT THE BITE" tied to a fence in Port Hedland.

props.synopsis: Residents and tourists are urged to take precautions after two people died after contracting Murray Valley Encephalitis in WA's Pilbara.

title.children: Health alert issued after mosquito-borne virus kills two people in northern Western Australia

image.altText: Hands hold a mobile phone displaying a scam text message

props.synopsis: A new registry could make it mandatory for texts to disclose a sender ID in the latest crackdown by the government on SMS text scammers.

title.children: Sick of getting scam texts? A new registry could help differentiate legitimate texts from scams

image.altText: A man in a suit speaking at a lectern.

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank's new deputy governor plays down this week's inflation surprise, saying there is plenty of economic data between now and the bank's next interest rate meeting in August.

title.children: 'Bad mistake to set policy on one number': RBA deputy plays down this week's inflation shock

image.altText: A bottle of OxyContin

props.synopsis: The US Supreme Court rules against an estimated $9 billion Purdue Pharma bankruptcy plan that would have shielded the wealthy Sackler family from legal liability over opioid-related overdoses.

title.children: US Supreme Court blocks Oxycontin maker's bankruptcy which shielded Sackler family

image.altText: A police officer walks past a sign for Robb elementary school with Welcome above and Bienvenidos below

props.synopsis: The former schools police chief and the former officer are indicted over their response to the school shooting in Uvalde, Texas in 2022.

title.children: Former Uvalde police charged over slow response to school shooting

image.altText: A pregnant woman holds her stomach

props.synopsis: South Australia's health department may have "miscalculated" the due dates of hundreds of pregnant women, prompting concerns some could have been induced too early, ABC News can reveal.

title.children: Due dates of more than 1,700 pregnant women may have been 'miscalculated', SA Health says
